UnitType.Backstory:
You seek to know more about Relias? His past? The man he was? That past will tell you nothing, for Relias has changed, and I - Janusk of Krandir - will swear to this before any Lord who asks. When first we met - when we traveled together as youths - Relias was not pleasant company. Weak; arrogant; condescending; convinced that his noble birth, and the skills he had learned from the acolytes of Delin - those spells given in the book of Annielum's Fire - made him superior to the common man.
Why did I travel with him? Hah. He had more money than he knew what to do with - and I got more than my share of it, if you would know the truth. Bought more wine - weapons - women - than I knew what to do with. But since the expedition... my Queen, that gave his life purpose. You gave his life purpose. Is he prepared for what is to come now? Will he be able to act as sovereign in your stead, when he reaches the East? We'll find out, won't we?
Can I have the rest of that ale now?

Treat me as you would any other member of the expedition - I ask for no pampering, no special treatment, no separate quarters when we take lodgings. Excepting this: I will require a certain amount of time each evening to study - to work with the amulet the queen entrusted to me, for the mana within is intended not only to wake the Oracle, but to aid us in overcoming whatever obstacles fate may place in our path. Give me that and I will prove I can accomplish what those doubting fools back home could only dream of.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Let's get moving Relias! We have to find the stone.

UnitType.Backstory: They're all dead... my brothers... it's my fault. I couldn't save them. There is little left for me now but to honor their memory in any way that I can. I have long walked the path of meditation and peace. I must now set that aside and use my talents to find those responsible for this heinous deed and see that they are punished. Perhaps with this service the Five will grant me some peace in the realms beyond - something I can never attain in this life.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Odenvell lies somewhere to the east, through a valley near the city of Eddler's Ford. Let me join your quest and guide you there, Relias. To the Temple, and the Oracle's chamber within.

UnitType.Backstory: Themisto? Sir... his ideas are all well and good, but the true soldier will have studied not only Themisto, but Vergaxa, and Haersham, and... what? You have not heard of Haersham? Ah. Your Queen's thinking is perhaps a bit... provincial, Lord. Karavox encourages his men to be more inclusive. There is wisdom and bravery to be found amongst all peoples, not just those of the West, wouldn't you agree? You'll forgive me for speaking so bluntly, sir, but here in the East... things are different. War is waged on many fronts, in many different ways. You'll learn this, in time.

Aye, the blood of the Ironeers runs in my veins. There's family of mine will tell you we descend from the Aivernach, but I never wanted to be no miner. No farmer either. Can't stand staying in the same place too long. When Dariun found me - I was headed south. Headed to Vas Norga, thinking I'd catch a ship for the west. He persuaded me to help him; made me part of the Free Riders. A dozen or so years now, I've been out here now, helping the Riders. We try to keep the roads safe... keep the Butchermen to the North of Grennhelm. Tame the thieves to the south, too.... the Hashanii. Don't get me started talking about them.

You think Zayedd is stealing? You think Zayedd is wrong to take tribute? You do not know this land; you do not know these Butchermen. I tell you what I told your people when I took the gold; you cannot fight these monsters as you fight ordinary men; they do not seek money, or possessions, or women... they seek blood. I gave this advice, the benefit of my experience, because you have come to a hostile land, Relias. Do not think because you can claim descent from the Amarians of old that you will be welcome here.

Yes, I come from the west. From the arena, at Walderon. I was a fighter in the pits... killed more than my share of slaves, and beasts for the amusement of your kind, little Lord. Not that I hold it against you... I'd do the same, if I'd been born to the heights you were. First chance I got though... killed my overseer, and came East. A little more dangerous here, yes, but I don't mind. Fighting's what I do best; happy to do it for you, long as your money holds out.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: You call yourself King? You are but a boy. Though I suppose... if you have %d gildar to hire me... I am your man.

UnitType.Backstory: Yes, I am far from home, my Lord. What was my home. Sharrazan - city of the dragon. I was an acolyte of the order, but the elders of my tribe cast me out, for daring to learn the sword, for daring to suggest that we should learn to fight for our place in this world, that we should have stood up to the Titans when they destroyed our homes, and our holy places.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Relias, Lord of Resoln. K'uo Sian would be honored to join your company, for a modest fee of %d gildar.

UnitType.Quote: 'I am imprisoned by my regret. You should flee before it claims you as well.'
UnitType.Backstory:
Once Padar to the peoples of Antheros, his name is now cursed forever. For as Curgen's army drew near, Amhah made a pact with the Titan. A thousand souls, he promised the Lord of Imperium, if Curgen would spare his people from destruction. To this, Curgen agreed. And so from the land's unfortunates - the poor, the lame, the cripples, and the criminal - Amhah gathered those thousand, and brought them to his Temple. And with his own hands, with his own knife, he sacrificed them. One by one, upon altars consecrated to the Five, sobbing as he did so, believing that the blasphemous act would keep his city safe.
But Curgen had lied. On the field of Gaer Blodwyn, the Titan met Amhah, and refused his sacrifice. The thousand who died rose once more, from the very pits they had been buried in, and these became the Butchermen. And Amhah, bound in service to Curgen by his heinous acts, became their leader... cursed to wander the world, undead, undying, for as long as Helias burns in the sky.

UnitType.Quote: 'The life of my foe is my fortune and my feast.'
UnitType.Backstory:
These brutally strong creatures are found in arctic climes. Argynn said of them 'they have the strength of a hundred men and the temper of a hundred scorned maidens.'
Garrote horns are often used in various alchemical remedies and potions, and are thus extremely valuable.

UnitType.Quote: 'The life of my foe is my fortune and my feast.'
UnitType.Backstory:
These brutally strong creatures are found in arctic climes. Argynn said of them 'they have the strength of a hundred men and the temper of a hundred scorned maidens.'
Garrote horns are often used in various alchemical remedies and potions, and are thus extremely valuable.

UnitType.Quote: 'My strength is unequaled, my wrath unbounded.'
UnitType.Backstory:
Ogres are huge, tremendously powerful monsters, giants driven by the most basic of needs; hunger, shelter, lust. Reclusive, territorial, they are believed to be at least as intelligent as trolls, though the sages do not suggest engaging them in conversation... or combat, for that matter, unless one is prepared to fight to the death.
Ogres are infatuated with gildar and are known to carry mighty fortunes with them.

UnitType.Quote: 'Over the forests of the world, I am the true sovereign.'
UnitType.Backstory:
Wargs are fell creatures, wolves mutated by dark magics thousands of years ago. They are stronger and more cunning than their non-magical counterparts. They prefer to hunt alone, and will fight over territory rather than ally themselves with their brethren.
Timber wargs are the most common of the breed, though their pelts are rare enough that they can still be sold to merchants for a fair amount of gildar.

These are the thousand who cannot die, unholy survivors of a pact made by Amhah in the time before this one. Butchermen believe, however, that if they kill another, their victims will become trapped - undead, undying, doomed to wander the world forever - in their place, and they can pass on to death.

These are the thousand who cannot die, unholy survivors of a pact made by Amhah in the time before this one. Butchermen believe, however, that if they kill another, their victims will become trapped - undead, undying, doomed to wander the world forever - in their place, and they can pass on to death.

These are the thousand who cannot die, unholy survivors of a pact made by Amhah in the time before this one. Butchermen believe, however, that if they kill another, their victims will become trapped - undead, undying, doomed to wander the world forever - in their place, and they can pass on to death.

These were bred by the Lady Umber, in the time before this one, for use in those battles now known as the Umbran Wars. Some of these monsters survived the Cataclysm, and have now been captured and tamed by the great Channelers of the East.
Umberdroth plates are highly valued by merchants and can be exchanged for a goodly amount of gildar.

UnitType.Description: Harbingers of War are powerful melee units, able to lots of damage to those that fall within their range. They are the most elite of the Trog armies and not many can withstand their attacks.
UnitType.Backstory:
The sound of their boots upon the citys cobblestones shall haunt my dreams, in this life and the next. - Hengut the Younger of Odenvell.
Trog heavy infantry. The armies of the Titans of old - the endless swarms of soldiers depicted in the great paintings and murals recovered from Imperiums ruins - were often led by units similar to these, whose appearance foretold the coming of battle, of death and destruction.

These eight-legged monstrosities, spiders twisted and mutated by fell magic, have been known to not just consume, but seek out the flesh of men. They paralyze their prey and drain them of their blood before discarding the remains amongst their drones.
Adventurers foolish enough to pursue the Harridan (sometimes called the Giant Black Widow) in the hopes of harvesting some of its highly valued silk are usually rewarded with death.

UnitType.Quote: In shadows I lurk, ever hungry for the life that was taken from me.
UnitType.Backstory:
These are Drednii that primarily inhabit swamplands - weaker Demons who long escaped the service of those who summoned them to this plane. Weak though they may be, they still yearn for the souls of Men.
Demon Horns are often used in various alchemical remedies and magical experiments and are extremely valuable.
